com.tractrac.subscription.lib.impl.io

Class TypeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tractrac.subscription.lib.impl.io.TypeController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.tractrac.dataflow.lib.api.live.IConnectionListener, com.tractrac.dataflow.lib.api.live.ILiveDataListener, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LatestDataController, OnlineDataController, SequenceDataController

    public abstract class TypeController
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.tractrac.dataflow.lib.api.live.IConnectionListener, com.tractrac.dataflow.lib.api.live.ILiveDataListener, java.lang.Runnable
    A TypeController is tied to a specific TypeDescriptor and works independently from all other TypeControllers.

    It takes care of fetching live and stored data (if enabled) and automatically asks for stored data if, e.g., the live connection has been temporarily lost.

    A TypeController can work on its own, but is normally added to and handled by DataControllerAsio.

    Author:
    Jan Marthedal Rasmussen
